Issues.Title: Refactor `ISelectionService` to replace `ArrayList` and enable Nullability
Issues.Body:
Refactored `ISelectionService` to replace `ArrayList` and enable Nullability.

I had to submit a PR to Runtime to fix the nullability on `ISelectionService.PrimarySelection`, this PR will need to be rebased to main once that change has been made available. Until then this will have build errors.
https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/pull/81254

Related: #8140

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8528)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Refactor `ISelectionService` to replace `ArrayList` and enable Nullability" (#8528)

Issues.Title: [LOC] KeysConverter returns "None" for Windows.Forms.Keys::None in all languages
Issues.Body:
### Which files are affected?

Previously reported at https://github.com/File-New-Project/EarTrumpet/issues/548.
Related area https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/8440.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Log into a non-English machine
2. Run the following PowerShell snippet:

  ```powershell
  [Reflection.Assembly]::LoadFile("C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App\6.0.10\System.Windows.Forms.dll") | Out-Null
  $Converter = New-Object Windows.Forms.KeysConverter
  $Converter.ConvertToString($Null, [System.Globalization.CultureInfo]::CurrentUICulture, [Windows.Forms.Keys]::None)
  ```
3. Observe `None` output

### Which languages are affected?

All non-English
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[LOC] KeysConverter returns "None" for Windows.Forms.Keys::None in all languages" (#8527)

Issues.Title: Cannot resize controls in runtime and has an exception when moving controls
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.23068.16

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

work in .Net 6.0, and reproduced from .Net 7.0

### Issue description

In Winforms repo, there has a [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app, cannot resize controls in .Net 7.0 & 8.0 and has an exception when moving controls in .Net 8.0.
![8 0Issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/213832129-deedfb87-c995-49a4-8ae3-a9c281581b56.gif)


### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cannot resize controls in runtime and has an exception when moving controls" (#8515)

Issues.Title: Fix control select and exception when moving controls
Issues.Body:
Related: #8515

I have fixed the exceptions in `DropSourceBehavior` and `SelectionUIService`. But the resize via the editor still doesn't work.

Issues.Title: Enable Thread's DPI hosting behavior for mixed mode DPI applications.
Issues.Body:
fixes #8144 

WinForms now supports mixed mode DPI scenarios for applications hosted in Visual Studio. This requires the explicit alteration of default [hosting behavior](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/windef/ne-windef-dpi_hosting_behavior) on the threads creating the main UI, which Visual Studio has done to allow for mixed mode DPI child elements while in PermonitorV2 DPI mode.

 However, when investigating issue #8144, it was found that WinForms control parenting was failing in the designer within Visual Studio due to threads creating WinForms controls not enabling mixed mode hosting, resulting in a failure to build the parenting hierarchy when the DpiAwarenessContext differs, and not yet parented to Visual Studio. 

To support mixed mode DPI outside of Visual Studio hosting or WinForms standalone applications, mixed mode DPI hosting needs to be enabled on the threads that creating windows in WinForms.



###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8519)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Enable Thread's DPI hosting behavior for mixed mode DPI applications." (#8519)

Issues.Title: Removed extra code for the ListBox.ItemHeight property
Issues.Body:
Fixes #4463

## Proposed changes

- Introduces a new private property `DefaultHeight` with **the intended value** equals Winforms Control.DefaultFont.Height (for example in Windows.Forms it is **Segoe UI, Size 9, Height 16** by default).
- Removes the DefaultValue attribute from the `ListBox.ItemHeight` property;
- Implements `ResetItemHeight` and `ShouldSerializeItemHeight` methods ([see more](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/desktop/winforms/controls/defining-default-values-with-the-shouldserialize-and-reset-methods?view=netframeworkdesktop-4.8)).
- The ListBox.DefaultItemHeight constant marked as obsolete. The `ListBox.ItemHeight` is now depended on actual `DefaultFont.Height` value.
- The `ListBox.ItemHeight` property still returns the value of the  `_itemHeight` property as usual.
- Existing unit tests weren't changed.
- New unit test `ListBox_Height_IsEqualDefaultHeight_IfDefaultFontIsChanged` is added.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Fixes the Issue which impacts user experience,  breaks DPI and Font scaling. For the _newly created_ control at 100% scaling, designer should generate the same value as is defined by the Default. There is no extra code.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15823268/104525385-e63a8080-55b4-11eb-8018-1cd886b658a0.png)

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15823268/104525352-d1f68380-55b4-11eb-9bf4-fafbf11c85f4.png)


## Test methodology

- Manual (Issue can be tested via substitution of dlls, complete restart of the VS recommended)
- Unit test


 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- dotnet 8.0.100-alpha.1.22607.6

Issues.Title: Making `DataGridView` icons more clear
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #7722


## Proposed changes

- Added a `ControlPaint.CreateBitmapWithInvertedForeColor` method for inverting colors of the bitmap if the image's primary color has low contrast with a background.
- Used the `ControlPaint.CreateBitmapWithInvertedForeColor` method for `DataGridViewRowHeaderCell` images if HC mode is on.
- Covered the `ControlPaint.CreateBitmapWithInvertedForeColor` method with unit tests.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Images in `DataGridViewRowHeaderCell` become more clear.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

Issues.Title: RichTextBox could not be used in VS designer
Issues.Body:
### Environment

17.4.4

### .NET version

7.0.102

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

_No response_

### Issue description
when drag a RichTextBox to a Form, VS Designer will show this error:
Built-in COM has been disabled via a feature switch. See https://aka.ms/dotnet-illink/com for more

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1876179/213693437-a7444221-4877-457d-a087-415f1a4e3970.png)


### Steps to reproduce

just drag a RichTextBox to a Form

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "RichTextBox could not be used in VS designer" (#8514)

Issues.Title: Automation case about ErrorProvider failed with "Cannot access a disposed object"
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.23068.16

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, cannot repro in previous versions

### Issue description

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/213655624-c6592448-98f2-413e-8f63-c82f811b9c79.png), related causing PR: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8486
_System.ObjectDisposedException
  HResult=0x80131622
  Message=Cannot access a disposed object.
  Source=System.Drawing.Common
  StackTrace:
   at System.Drawing.Icon.get_Handle()
   at System.Drawing.Icon.get_Size()
   at System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.IconRegion.get_Size()
   at System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.ErrorWindow.Update(Boolean timerCaused)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.ErrorWindow.Add(ControlItem item)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.ControlItem.AddToWindow()
   at System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.ControlItem.set_Error(String value)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ErrorProvider.SetError(Control control, String value)
   at XErrorProvider.set_RightToLeft(TParams p, Boolean rtl) in C:\Users\xxx\Desktop\XErrorProvider_P1\XErrorProvider_P1\XErrorProvider.cs:line 455
   at System.RuntimeMethodHandle.InvokeMethod(Object target, Void** arguments, Signature sig, Boolean isConstructor)
   at System.Reflection.MethodInvoker.Invoke(Object obj, IntPtr* args, BindingFlags invokeAttr)_


### Steps to reproduce

It reproduces steadily in our automation case about errorProvider, but we cannot repro manually in TextBox and ErrorProvider, then errorProvider.setError
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Automation case about ErrorProvider failed with "Cannot access a disposed object"" (#8513)

Issues.Title: System.Windows.Forms.Design.DateTimePickerDesigner is missing
Issues.Body:
### Environment

N/A

### .NET version

.NET 6

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Worked in .NET Framework.

### Issue description

We need to have DateTimePicker controls available in a WF designer that we host in our app, which is being ported from .NET Framework to .NET 6. As per https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/4908, DateTimePickerDesigner hasn't been ported from .NET Framework.

Looking at the decompiled sources of `DateTimePickerDesigner`, it's not much code and the reason it wasn't ported is unclear. In fact, if we add a DateTimePicker to the designer programmatically, it appears there but is not clickable, and a clickable component is added to the component tray.

We'd really appreciate any suggestions on solving this.

### Steps to reproduce

N/A

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "System.Windows.Forms.Design.DateTimePickerDesigner is missing" (#8501)

Issues.Title: Setting GenerateMember to false is not removing class member
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022
Version 17.4.4
VisualStudio.17.Release/17.4.4+33213.308
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.8.09032

### .NET version

.Net7, .Net6. Others not tested.

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Yes in old .NET framework designer.

### Issue description

`GenerateMember = false` must remove corresponding class member from `*.Designer.cs`. Actual behavior:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17767561/212486575-cff39aa2-d3e7-4726-a71d-5f24000f856e.png)


### Steps to reproduce

Any winforms project. Open designer, select any existing control on the form, set `GenerateMember` to `false`.
Project to quick test:
[GenerateMemberTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10418373/GenerateMemberTest.zip)

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Setting GenerateMember to false is not removing class member" (#8505)

Issues.Title: Fix multiselect in OpenFileDialog
Issues.Body:
Query for the right interface before getting results and guard correctly.

Adds regression test and fixes a mistake in ComScope.

Adds a little cleanup for easier debugging and I left in a few defines that are difficult to find and we'll want to use soon. (I tried a variety of approaches to automating, including sending key messages and using accessibility. Sending WM_COMMAND is far simpler.)

fixes: #8414


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8500)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix multiselect in OpenFileDialog" (#8500)

Issues.Title: Move GetIUnknownForObject calls to ComHelpers
Issues.Body:
We want to keep our Marshal calls in ComHelpers so we can do the right logic regarding ComWrappers vs. Marshal.

Remove AdviseHelper and use the new functionality to set up the notifications (much simpler).

Move IRichEditOleCallback to CsWin32. Add new static helper to DataObject to create from a native IDataObject.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Move GetIUnknownForObject calls to ComHelpers" (#8498)
